Remarkable activity for OER was observed in transition metal-based oxides, hydroxides, and related materials. Moreover, the different oxidation states of the metal encountered in these materials (often coexisting within the same structure), and a multitude of possible different structures, phases, and structural motifs provide enormous possibilities to tune the properties of these catalysts.
549, 551 Ni- and Co-based oxide materials are considered to be the most active for OER due to their optimal binding to oxygen species and reaction intermediates.
551 Because of their applicability for OER in neutral pH-conditions, Co-based materials are particularly attractive.
